content.text: Complete page 4 of Paula's letter with all text

text_sections.full_transcription:
Today - a limousine awaits
You as a dignitary.

Jeff, I'm so sorry that Dad can't
share the Nachus [Yiddish word for a feeling of pride and joy] we have regarding
your achievements. He would have been
overjoyed reading the article about
you in the New York magazine.
I was looking at family
Tapes. We had many, many parties,
anniversary parties etc, you enjoyed
being there.
Today you AVOID gatherings,
Parties - why?

Tonight is the deadline I
must get this manuscript to
Ghislaine.
If I know me, as soon
as I mail it I will think of
WHAT I should of Said. (4)

HOUSE_OVERSIGHT_000023

relationships: Ghislaine Maxwell collecting manuscripts for book
insights: 'limousine awaits You as a dignitary' - wealth/status achieved
'Nachas' - Yiddish for pride/joy from children's achievements
'He would have been overjoyed' - father missed son's rise
New York magazine article about Epstein
'many, many parties, anniversary parties' - social family
Past: 'you enjoyed being there' at family events
'Pencil is the deadline' - unclear phrase, possibly typo
Manuscript deadline set by Ghislaine Maxwell
Mother aware she'll think of more after sending
'WHAT I should of Said' - regret about incompleteness
forensic_notes: New York magazine profile mentioned - investigate date
Personality change documented: social to reclusive
Mother using Yiddish terms - cultural background
investigative_leads: Locate New York magazine article about Epstein
